# Key Things to Know Before Signing a Compromesso

## Financial Considerations
- **Deposit amount**: Typically 10-20% of purchase price—you'll lose this if you back out without valid cause
- **Notary fees**: Usually 2-4% of purchase price (buyer pays)
- **Agency commissions**: Often 3-4% (clarify who pays)
- **Taxes and registration**: Additional 7-14% depending on property type and your status
- **Survey/inspection costs**: Get a professional survey done beforehand

## Legal Protections
- **Have a lawyer review everything** before signing—this is essential, not optional
- Ensure the seller has clear title and no liens or mortgages
- Check for outstanding property taxes or municipal debts
- Verify zoning compliance and any building permits for renovations
- Confirm the property description matches reality

## Common Risks
- **Bureaucratic delays**: Closing can take months; clarify timelines
- **Undisclosed defects**: Structural issues, moisture, illegal additions
- **Boundary disputes**: Get a proper survey
- **Inheritance complications**: Verify the seller has authority to sell
- **Utility connections**: Confirm water, gas, electricity are properly registered

## Red Flags
- Pressure to sign quickly
- Vague property descriptions
- Seller unwilling to provide documentation
- Unusually low prices
- Properties in dispute or with unclear ownership

**Bottom line**: Hire a local real estate lawyer and geometra (surveyor) before committing. The upfront cost is worth avoiding expensive problems later.
